citations: Michael Burlingame,Abraham Lincoln: A Life(Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 2008), 1:78-79.

footnotes.text:
1This document exists only as a transcription taken from a transcription in an auction
                  catalog from 1914. Abraham Lincoln likely presented the bill to the Sangamon County
                  Commissionersâ€™ Court for payment.

2Lincoln served as an assistant to bothJohn Calhounand thenThomas M. Nealeduring their survey of Sangamon County from 1833 to 1835.Michael Burlingame,Abraham Lincoln: A Life(Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 2008), 1:78-79.
